name: Coca
Relationship: Antidote: GELS.Compare: ARS.; PAULIN.; CYP; CHAMOM.
Modalities: Better: quick motion in open air

Heart: Palpitation, with weak heart and dyspnoea
Head: Headaches of high altitudes
Headache with vertigo, preceded by flashes of light
Fainting fit from climbing mountains
Diplopia
Like a band across forehead
Shocks coming from occiput with vertigo
Tongue furred
Noises in ears
Tinnitus
Respiratory: Hawking of small, transparent pieces of mucus
Want of breath, short breath, especially in aged athletes, and alcoholic users
Stomach: Great satiety for a long time
Incarcerated flatus; rises with noise and violence, as if it would split the oesophagus
Longing for alcoholic liquors and tobacco
Mind: Sense of right and wrong abolished
Melancholy; bashful, ill at ease in society, irritable, delights in solitude and obscurity
Sleep: Can find no rest anywhere, but sleepy
Nervousness and nightly restlessness during teething

details: The mountaineer's remedy. Useful in a variety of complaints incidental to mountain climbing, such as palpitation, dyspnoea, anxiety and insomnia. Exhausted nervous system from physical and mental strain. Cavities of teeth. LOSS OF VOICE. Give 5-6 drops, every half hour, two hours before expected demand on voice. Nocturnal enuresis. Emphysema (QUEBRACHO).
Natural History: Erythroxylon Coca(The Divine Plant of the Incas - but the Spanish priests denounced it as un delusio del demonio)
